Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The apt was just like the pictures! So much attention to detail went into the decor. It was clean, comfortable and lacked nothing! HOWEVER, I ended up in that beautiful shower with the rain showerhead, all lathered up in fine body wash and the water turned cold with no way to rinse off the soap! I was Mortified! I contacted the Host, Live via text to let him know about my experience. He read my text and never responded! Can you say "INSULT TO INJURY!" This was a Horrible ending to such a wonderful short stay! He showed me No empathy or concern. He did not acknowledge how awful that was for me. No apology, NOTHING!! The footsteps of the people that were in the apt above me, not a problem. They even had a party for St. Patty's Day with music, loud conversation and walking back and forth till 2am, I didn't even mention it. But the cold shower took my experience from a 5 star rating to a 2! I was so disappointed! So if you Love COLD showers and Cold hosts, this is the place for you!

review_text: Neil and Toneâ€™s place was good for a quick overnight on our drive through Pennsylvania. It is not far from the I-81 and easy to find in a quiet, safe neighborhood. We received really clear check in instructions and also quick answers to our questions. There is a full size kitchen as well as laundry facilities - both are always appreciated by us when weâ€™re on the road. The bed was comfortable and there were extra blankets and pillows handy. As mentioned by others (and in the ad), there is no TV but good Wi-Fi allowed us to easily stream on our computer, and there is no window in the bedroom. The place is no frills, and I probably wouldnâ€™t choose it if I were going to be spending several days, but it was what we needed for the night, and it was definitely a good value.

This facility is a home and the hosts are genuinely interested in making your stay memorable. This is a suburban setting; quiet, super safe and conducive to joggers and walkers. Parking is available in their driveway.
Located between Hershey and Amish country in Lancaster; an easy 30-45 minute drive to either site.
Fully applianced kitchen, washer and dryer, and spacious walk-in shower.
The hosts are genuinely interested in making your stay memorable; their personal pursuits in giving back and reaching out to those in need are reflected in the manner they operate the private lodging for their guests.

review_text:
The place looked better than the pictures. Spacious rooms and easy checkin. Well stocked with toiltries and coffee.
The negative is that the temperature appears to be controlled by the main house. The thermostat in the room doesn't do anything. I woke up in the middle of the night and it was 75 in the room. I had to open the windows wide open to cool the room down so I could sleep. It was in the low 20s outside. They do provide a fan which also helped. I probably would not choose this place if you like to sleep on the cool side.

review_text:
Clean and comfortable.
Glad to see a bathtub, but alas no stopper.
Bed sheets are polyester. Yuck, but whatever. But shocked to find no mattress pad,just bare mattress under a very thin bottom sheet. I was creeped out contemplating the various peoples' sweat and other.......and having no washable barrier between the mattress and the sheet.
Clock on the wall: no battery.
Coffee area: 1 keurig-type coffee and lots of Splenda, no sugar.
Odd that the dorm sized refrigerator opens to the wall. Hinge can easily be switched to make it more convenient.
I just didn't feel the love.
It was a place to crash.
I wouldn't go back.

review_text:
Everything was as described. The free parking is on Commonwealth Way, the employee parking signs where we parked were free and we did not get towed.
The only troublesome thing was the two eye burners that would overheat if using both eyes, so used only one. There were instructions on how to use the burners. It seems to constantly need to be unlocked. There wasn't a broom and dustpan so you may want to bring a little hand one in case you spill something and the knob in the cabinet kept coming off.
None of the issues above warranted a drop in rating. Overall this place was perfect in location, size, and amenities. Everything was perfect, thus, five stars.
My sister and I enjoyed our stay and would certainly visit again if the need arose. Thanks, Ben.

review_text: What a find! If you're looking for a place in Harrisburg, look no further. Beautifully decorated, comfortable, spacious - and quiet! But this has something else that makes it stand out - a fabulous host that really stocks the place like no other! Nice selection in the bar area.. Additionally, LIndsay went out of her way to provide us vegan food especially for us - tons of items! I've never had a hostess go to such efforts. Both beds are super soft and comfy, and she also paid attention to our chemical sensitivities with the linens, which was much appreciated. It was the kind of home that truly felt like home, right from the moment we arrived. Easy walk to the water and its nice walking path, with Little Amps coffee on the way (yummy butterfly pea coffee) and do not miss Millworks! Best brewery/art gallery I've seen. We would love to return.

The living room had a variety of alcohol stocked and mixers in the fridge. The bed was very comfortable and we slept peacefully. The back patio was a nice place to sit and have tea. It was surprisingly quiet.

review_text:
Wonderful place in Harrisburg! True city living in walking distance to many things. But with a reserved parking place, you can come and go and never have to worry about parking! The home is wonderfully decorated and the beds are soooo comfortable. The air conditioning and white noise machine made for a great nights sleep. The complementary snacks, beverages and stuff for breakfast were greatly appreciated. If we had known how wonderful this place was, we honestly would have changed our plans to stay a second night! â¤ï¸
Details you may want to know- the steps are steep, so not ideal for mobility challenged (both bedrooms and bathroom are upstairs). Also, since they ask you take off your shoes upon entering, donâ€™t run down the steps in your socks! (Trust me it doesnâ€™t end well!) The parking lot is diagonally across from the house, on a different street. Most of the streets are one way and narrow, so if you miss it youâ€™ll have to go several blocks around to take another stab at finding it. The steps and parking arenâ€™t problems at all for most folks, but had I been traveling with elderly folks or tiny kids it might have been.
Truly a gem of a place near great food and about 20 minutes from the airport.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We spent two nights in early May 2024 at Danielle's apartment. Very nice overall! Danielle communicated via email in a prompt and timely way. The listing and photographs accurately matched the property. The unit was very clean. Self check-in was fast and easy. The internet wifi was strong and reliable. We parked on the street about a block away. We walked about 15 minutes to reach the capitol and center city, and the nearby river walk was a pleasant stroll.
Just a few small things to keep in mind: the neighborhood seemed plenty safe, but groceries (aside from a gas station convenience store) aren't nearby -- so bring along with you whatever sustenance you plan to consume. Also (and as the listing accurately depicts), there are a couple of dinette chairs but no sofa in the living space. Finally, the bed lacked a box spring and therefore felt a little squishy.

name: Breaunna
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
February 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Honest reviews are crucial for enhancing future guests' experiences. Karen proved to be a great host, but challenges with the pool and hot tub impacted our stay. Despite requesting prior to our stay a safe temperature of 100 for my pregnancy, the hot tub consistently exceeded limits at 102-104. Making it hard to put more than my legs in. The pool, advertised at 83-85, measured 73-75, affecting our plans. Despite shivering I was able to swim for a short period of time. When brought to the host's attention, the advice was to swim when the sun was out. The long icy path to the pool room and the requirement to remove shoes in the cold were inconvenient.
Cleaning standards were lacking, with dead bugs in the bathroom, hair in sinks and bed, and potential dirt/debris in one bed. We made the best of it, enjoying game nights with provided board games, but suggest improvements for future guests.
Also keep in mind the guests are beneath the hosts and can hear each other when walking and talking

review_text:
This accommodation was very nice and Brian and Karen are great hosts; very friendly and responsive! We loved the patio outside and the deer that visited. The private entrance and parking were wonderful. This villa is located in an upscale, safe neighborhood, which is very important to us. Personally, I found the temperature in the unit very cold, but my sister loved it. The host provides space heaters so I was able to sleep well. We used the pool twice, and the hot tub was broken so we couldn't use that. The hosts were at the mercy of servicemen and it was out of their control.
We enjoyed the kitchen and the host even let us borrow their hand mixer and a pie plate. Oh, and the microwave also doubles as a convection oven so we were able to cook!
There is little room for the fold-out bed (we set it up in the living room), but it's a nice option if you need it (we did.)
Overall we had an excellent stay and I would definitely recommend it!
